subject: Relationships
title: The Cycle of Abuse
description: A 60-second lesson on The Cycle of Abuse.

hook.text: Tension builds. An explosion happens. Then comes the apology, the sweetness. And the cycle begins again.

buildup.text: Lenore Walker identified the abuse cycle in 1979: tension building, incident, reconciliation, and calm.

discovery.text: The 'honeymoon phase' after abuse creates powerful intermittent reinforcement â€” the most addictive reward pattern.

twist.text: Victims often describe the reconciliation phase as the best part of the relationship. That's the trap.

climax.text: Each cycle normalizes worse behavior. What shocked you in month one becomes background noise by year three.

punchline.text: The sweetest moments in an abusive cycle are the bait in the trap.

quiz.question: What makes the abuse cycle so hard to break?
options: The reconciliation phase creates addictive intermittent reinforcement
